title: Doors can now be owned by groups of players
body:
### Features

- Players can now add other players as owners of their doors
- Some optimizations to networking
- Changes to door ui so that it changes if you own it or are able to own it.
- Changes to door menu ui
author: Fnasp

comments.body: Great PR! Thank you for your contribution

title: Optimizations
body:
Standardized namings of members.
Corrected some access modififiers.
Reordered some member properties.
Made spaces around function args uniform across the project.
Remove unused using statements.

Fixed a sound playing issue, such that it is played at the correct location.
author: IRLadderGoat

comments.body: Really interesting, thanks for that !

title: Created door menu and made some changes to door logic
body:
### Features

- Created a radial menu for interactions with the doors that is displayed when holding R and looking at a door

- Removed the sell function from pressing R and moved it to a button in the door menu

- Moved SellDoor and PurchaseDoor functions from the player class to the doorlogic class

- Created a door title that can be changed in the door menu

- A button for locking and unlocking door

- Some placeholder buttons for features that is yet to be implemented

- Made a change to the door ui so that door title is properly displayed
author: Fnasp

comments.body: Hello this is very good for a first contribution, thanks you ! I was wondering maybe you can fix this little issue, when I use the door renaming button I get stuck and I can't close the menu until I move outside of the door range.
Is that when the text field is visible? If so you can just hit escape or click on the field and hit enter. Can create a close button on it if that would make it more clear on how to close it.

You're right, idk why but when I first checked your PR it wasn't working but now it is, I just noticed something else, when I write text it doesn't show on the UI but not really a bug tho. I push it thanks !

title: Fixed player collider, hands fix

- Hands fix: Now, when you sharply turn and release an object, it does not fly away at speed. Also increased throw strength

Also included is some text at spawn to tell users to turn around (Don't know why it's doing that)
Also added an enclosed room with doors that you could own fully

title: Door expansion
body:
Playing around with door hinges
Frame can be added into prefab, just need to rotate only the comp Prefab setup will feature modular doors with options for doors, frames, handles Lower frame toggle for setting up interior/exterior doors Multiple material setup for inter/exterior transitions Also not shown here is setup for double doors
Included tintable frame
Still WIP for scaling, minor details, and topo
author: goodmittens

comments.body: Do you plan to implement a system that makes doors map independent?

What do you mean by doors map? Not sure how functional it will be in terms of prefab, technically if prefabs are exposed this would be a setup for pcg. This is more for map artists to have modular pieces and options when setting up buildings. If you mean door material, yes it is currently independent with it's own (messy atm) UVs. The knob will also be separate for animation.
I would like to supply a few base materials options for all pieces over time.

I mean make sure that doors are not needed to be hardcoded into a map. But can be used on any map.
Basicly make sure that the doors would not be a bigger hustle in s&box than they are in gmod

They already have the door prefab setup? This is swapping (actually just adding more) models and textures. The models included would be for instances of the prefab. The door prefab would then be included in a building prefab. All instances could be stored in an array for example if someone wanted to go that far. Which could be randomized or tagged to be used in certain buildings. Or they could simply lay out instances, it's up to whoever uses it

I thought draft PR was private tbh. Also I need to update minimal so I am going to grab a new branch and make it just double door and a few variations for now. I also will keep it off PR until they say they are ready, my bad!

title: Data Persistence, saving and loading player data
body:
Should work
Works on my machine
Log.Infos are usefull
author: EuroBlue

comments.body:
Could you give a brief description of how it works?

With examples

It creates a folder in the sbox data "playersdata"
There are json files of objects of the class SavedPlayer
SavedPlayer is a class that stores everything you want to store
When a new player is created it checks if there is file file in the playersdata folder with the steamid
If it exists it creates Insctance of SavedPlayer: loadedplayer
loads the data from loadedplayer to the actual Player GameObject

It updates the playerdata in the json file when the RemovePlayer function is called

Right now it stores only money, but its very modular very demure, very commented, very mindful
So it's easy to expand on need
MoneyBase seems to be duplicated
Yeah forgot to commit the merge fix now it's good

title: Player HUD resizing with money
body:
Sousou wanted a more dynamically horizontal HUD. Instead of a lot of empty space, the HUD increases horizontally based on name length. The unwanted side effect of that is that when your money changes digits, then it also affects the size of the HUD.

This is probably undesired.

title: feat: moved interaction logic to its own interface/class
body:
Moved the printer interaction logic away from the `PlayerInteraction` class to its own class that can be inherited from other components. This keeps everything clean and modular.

GameObjects to implement interactivity must have the `Interact` tag and a component that inherits the `IInteractable` interface and implements a `public void Interact( SceneTraceResult tr, GameObject player )` function.
author: QueenPM

comments.body: This makes sense, as for `PlayerInteraction.cs` could this be merged into a new DarkRP `CharacterController.cs` instead of it inheriting Walkers CharacterController. This will save stuff breaking if Facepunch are to update or depreciate the Walker CharacterController and allow expansion rather than creating more components to handle more inputs.

@The-Neco I think the `PlayerInteraction.cs` have no dependencies with the walker player controller from facepunch ( except maybe the camera var idk ) but even if they make some changes to it, it shouldn't break anything and at the worst case I will just use another way to get the local camera. But that may be a good idea for the future tho, because we will probably not depend on the walker character controller too much time because we will need at some point to add another camera for third person.

title: Feature/UI styling improvements
body:
Improved the TAB Menu UI & Player HUD.

Fixed the wrong operator being used when purchasing printers from `if (CurrentPrinter <= MaxPrinter)` to `if (CurrentPrinter < MaxPrinter)`, so that `int MaxPrinter = 2;` makes more sense. If 3 is the intended maximum, please change the integer.

All other changes are only styling and did not change or add any functionality.
author: QueenPM

comments.body: Very good, this Menu is dope !

title: Feature/improved chat
body:
Small changes to improve chat functionality

- Chat Opened/Closed is now controlled by a variable rather than `InputBox.HasFocus` for better control.
- Chat will keep the last 10 messages and only display "new" ones initially unless chat is opened.
author: QueenPM

comments.body: Really nice addition thanks you !
